title: How to Frost a Carrot Cake

steps.headline: Separate the white from the yolk of the egg.
Take a mixing heatproof bowl and add the sugar, water and corn syrup.
steps.description: Add the egg white (the yolk is not required in this recipe). Mix everything.

steps.headline: Place the bowl over a saucepan with simmering water over a stove.
Mix with a whisk till everything dissolves and then whisk hard till peaks form.
steps.description: This requires a bit of an effort as you have to whisk hard for some time. Peaks should be stiff.

steps.headline: Remove from heat and keep whisking till the frosting cools down.
Spread it over your carrot cake, all over the top and sides.
Make peaks by touching the top with a spoon or any object and lifting it.
steps.description: You can also make other designs. Experiment.

text: Separate the white from the yolk of the egg.  Take a mixing heatproof bowl and add the sugar, water and corn syrup. Add the egg white (the yolk is not required in this recipe). Mix everything. Place the bowl over a saucepan with simmering water over a stove.  Mix with a whisk till everything dissolves and then whisk hard till peaks form. This requires a bit of an effort as you have to whisk hard for some time. Peaks should be stiff. Remove from heat and keep whisking till the frosting cools down.  Spread it over your carrot cake, all over the top and sides. Be generous. Make peaks by touching the top with a spoon or any object and lifting it. You can also make other designs. Experiment. Leave it to cool.  Finished.
